column4: Thanks VCoolio . where can I change my pass without insert old pass? (my system does't authentificate my password for sudo, Software Source and..., I use lucid)
where can I change my pass without insert old pass? (my system does't authentificate my password for sudo, Software Source and..., I use lucid)
as root you can
How?
sudo -i  and then  passwd theusername
maybe sudo passwd username   is also working
when i type sudo -i, the system want form me the password and when i insert that, system say password wrong
then insert the correct password
its the password from your current logged in user
i know, but the system does't accept this!
but you are logged in with the user and password
so i am sure you have misstyped the password, using capslock,different keyboard-layout or something like that
I'm surprised, the main problem and joke is here, in login window, the system dont wanna me the password, but in any command after login and sudo, want me!
you have autologin enabled as it seems
ok, but waht can i do now?
remember your password
have a look at /var/log/auth.log about th error-message
sudo wants your user-password
cat /var/log/auth.log
and look for the error from sudo
